error.signature: error NU1107: Version conflict detected for 'PackageName'. Install/reference 'PackageName' directly to resolve this issue.

verdict.summary: NuGet version conflicts occur when different packages depend on incompatible versions of the same transitive dependency. Common with Microsoft.Extensions.* packages, Entity Framework Core, and Azure SDK packages. Fix by adding explicit top-level references to align versions.

dead_ends.action: Pinning all transitive dependencies to exact versions in the .csproj file
dead_ends.why_fails: Creates a maintenance burden where every package update requires manual version adjustment of all transitive dependencies. Version pins often conflict with the ranges required by direct dependencies, making future updates nearly impossible

dead_ends.action: Using assembly binding redirects (app.config) in .NET 8+ projects
dead_ends.why_fails: Assembly binding redirects are a .NET Framework concept. .NET 8 uses a different dependency resolution mechanism; adding binding redirects to modern .NET projects has no effect and adds confusion

workarounds.action: Add explicit PackageReference for the conflicting package to align versions
workarounds.how: Identify the conflicting package from the error message. Add a direct reference in your .csproj: <PackageReference Include="ConflictingPackage" Version="x.y.z" />. Choose the highest version required by any dependency. Run 'dotnet restore' to verify resolution

workarounds.action: Use Directory.Packages.props for centralized version management
workarounds.how: Enable central package management: add <ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>true</ManagePackageVersionsCentrally> to Directory.Build.props. Create Directory.Packages.props with <PackageVersion Include="PackageName" Version="x.y.z" /> entries. This ensures all projects use the same package versions, eliminating cross-project conflicts

leads_to.condition: when version conflict causes wrong assembly version to be loaded at runtime
when version conflict is caused by SDK version differences across projects

preceded_by.condition: when restore from an alternative source provides different package versions
when upgrading SDK introduces new default package versions that conflict

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Version conflict means packages exist but have incompatible version requirements; restore failure means one or more packages cannot be found at all
